intro: Corydalis elegans subsp. elegans, commonly known as the elegant corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and features basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a suitable candidate for woodland gardens. The flowers bloom in spring, adding a touch of color to shaded environments.
